results.title: Woven in time
results.brief_description: Features three woven ballets designed by Evelyn Roth, and interpreted by Tony Westman, in which the dancers work in and around various textures such as rope, netting and plastic.

results.title: Would you kiss a naked man? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Mary McLeod, R. Alan Gough and Northern Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in sexuality”.
Demonstrates that sexuality and nudity are a natural part of an honest relationship between two people who care for one another by presenting a dramatized interlude between two teenagers in which they discuss the meaning of their relationship and engage in sexual play. From the series “Concepts in Sexuality”.

results.title: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens
results.creator_credit: Vertigo Productions, France Z, M6 Films, Orly Films, Les Productions Jacque Roiffeld, Aissa Djabri, Farid Lahouassa, Manuel Munz and Thomas Gilou
results.brief_description: No job, no home, no family; Eddie (Richard Anconina) has hit rock bottom. One day, as he is walking through Le Sentier (the rag trade district of Paris) he is attacked by a gang of hustlers. Rescued by Victor Benzakem (Richard Bohringer), a successful rag-trader who mistakes Eddie for a Sephardic Jew, Eddie is offered a job. Only too happy to seize an opportunity to start over, Eddie (who is a gentile) tries his best to maintain the pretence of his adopted ‘jewishness’. From the fabric warehouse, Eddie is given an opportunity to observe the rites and secret hand shakes of the flashy, fast talking garment district: a melting pot of race, religion and culture. His eyes also catch the beauty of his employer’s daughter, Sandra (Amira Casar). In order to draw her attention, Eddie decides to cut loose and start his own business. Starting with the classic story of the stranger who finds himself in a community he knows nothing about, Thomas Gilou’s film presents a seldom-seen look into the lives and customs of France’s many ethnic groups. Cast includes Richard Anconina, Amira Casar, Vincent Elbaz, Elie Kakou, Richard Bohringer, and Jose Garcia.

results.title: Wot! no art
results.brief_description: An analysis of British society since 1945, and the relationship or lack thereof, of art to the people. Deals with the problem of people understanding and accepting “modern art”. “Art must be thought of as a basic human need, instead of a luxury that our society can only just afford”

results.title: Worth the risk
results.brief_description: To most people a road accident is something which always happens to the other fellow, yet, as the film points out, sooner or later one in every six people alive today will be involved in one. Every day road accidents occur on average one every three and a half minutes, yet everyday, pedestrians, cyclists, and motorists continue to take risks.

results.title: Worth how many words?
results.brief_description: A variety of fast and slow motion shots flash on the screen to stimulate and capture the audience. The narration explains how film and photography, time, motion, colour and form can be used to capture events and extend awareness and understanding. Emphasizes the versatility of the camera and unique uses in research and education.

results.title: Worry: I'm in big trouble now
results.creator_credit: Guidance Association, Motion Media and Donald Connors
results.brief_description: Designed to help young people understand and deal with their feelings and emotions. Presents the story of a boy whose neglect of this responsibilities leads to the disappearance of his younger brother. The viewer is left to decide what the boy will do and what he should do.

results.title: Worms, flat round and segmented
results.brief_description: Compares and contrasts three major phyla of worms: flatworms, roundworms and segmented worms. The approach to flatworms is experimental: worms are cut, demonstrating regeneration, and are subjected to light, demonstrating tropism. The approach to roundworms emphasises parasitism, and for the annelids the evolutionary advances of segmentation are stressed.

results.title: Worlds apart
results.creator_credit: Gregory Miller, Film Projects, Working Images Film & Video, Richmond Community Care, Garry McKechnie and Tony Le Nguyen
results.brief_description: A Vietnamese migrant family struggles to survive with their customary values in Australia. As the children reach adolescence, the conflict resulting from the difference between the two cultures intensifies. The children aim for independence. The father feels only shame heightened by the family living in high-rise commission flats and working as a factory worker, a fall of social standing. Cast includes Thanh-Vu Nguyen and Tamara Thao Nguyen.
